comments:
When trying the test connection with using "DB2 Universal JDBC driver" from Data Source Explorer, I got an error and could not connect to the DB2 database.

 Build date: 0.7.0.20060224
 OS: RHEL4 U2 WS ja_JP.UTF8
 SW: DB2 UDB ESE V8.1 FP 11  
 Steps to recreate problem:
        1- Open Data Source Explorer view
        2- Launch New Connection Profile wizard
        3- Select SQL Model-JDBC Connection as profile type
        4- Specify a name at New JDBC Connection profile panel and Click Next 
        5- Select the "IBM DB2 Universal for DB2 UDB V8.2" at the Specify a Driver and Connection Details" panel. (If the driver has not been defined,please Add the driver. )
        6- Click "Test connection" and ping is successfull.
        7- Click "Finish" 
        8- Right-click on the connection profile and select "Connect"
       And then, I got an error and could not connect to DB2. 

Expected: Connect successfully 
Additional: Eclipse is launched with -vmargs -Xj9 option


-- consolelog -------------

Larry:

This might be the same issue we've seen before.

This bug has been identified as a major bug by the enablement
testers. If at all possible, please find a fix or workaround asap because the
testers need to verify the fix (or finish the test) by Fri Apr 7.
This is a defect with the IBM JDBC driver not Data Tools.  The work around is to not use the -Xj9 option.
I specified -Xj9 option to launch eclipse, but this problem still occurred.
Without -Xj9 option, this problem occurred too in RHLE4.

From the verify error Java doc:
Thrown when the "verifier" detects that a class file, 
though well formed, contains some sort of internal inconsistency 
or security problem.

Is this being run with a security manager present?  Could there be a security setting on DB2 that is getting in the way?

Larry, perhaps you should check with any contact you can find in the DB2 JDBC group to find out if there are security considerations around using the method mentioned in the stack:
java.lang.VerifyError: class loading constraint violated (class:
com/ibm/db2/jcc/c/o method:
resetDB2Connection(Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;Lcom/ibm/db2/jcc/DB2BaseDataSource;)V)

Hi Larry, 
Any more information on this? This is marked as a major defect to be fixed by 04/07 for test exit.

I tried this with a DTP build  dtp-SDK_0.7RC1_032106.zip and DB2 v8.2 on WinXP, without the-Xj9 option and could not reproduce this issue. 
Testing team : Will testing on WindowsXP suffice ? If so pls try on WinXP

I have no idea what is going on here.  It looks exactly like the -Xj9 problem.  (Note the reference in the stacktrace to J9VMInternals.)   I would suggest trying the Sun JVM in order to complete the testing.  Can you provide a new stacktrace with the -Xj9 option turned off or running under the Sun JVM would be even better?

Build: dtp-SDK_0.7RC1_N032106

I got the same error with -Xint option. 
(Java: IBM J9 VM (build 2.3, J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Linux x86-32 j9vmxi3223ifx-20060124 (JIT Disabled))

In WinXP with IBM JDK1.5SR1, I got the same error. 

With the sun jdk1.5, the connection was successful but I got another error.(Database objects such as Table cannot retrieve with NPE at consolelog and I will open a new report for this problem.)

Rupesh, which JDK version do you use in your successful case?
Rupesh, I would like to know DB2 fixpack version you use.  (I use FP11.)

When I extracted the following components only and use -Xverify:none option with IBM JDK 1.5, this problem did not reproduce. I could connect to DB2 database and get the database object correctly. 

eclipse-SDK-3.2M6-win32.zip
dtp-SDK_0.7RC1_N032106.zip
emf-sdo-SDK-I200603300000.zip
xsd-SDK-I200603300000.zip

When I extracted the other components such as birt, wtp and so on, the problem occurred. 

I can continue to perform the testing with using this workaround, but I still leave this bug as "major"
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 130867 ***
This bug is a dupulicate of 130867
